infos.name: B2B Workflow
infos.description:
Die VIO.App B2B Workflow ergänzt eine neue Gruppe von Mitarbeiterrechten: die Bestellanfrage.

Damit kann man Mitarbeitern das Recht zum Aufgeben von Bestellungen entziehen, stattdessen wird ihnen die Bestellanfrage zugeordnet. Sie steht im internen Status von Bestellungen vor "offen".
Im Checkout sehen diese Mitarbeiter einen neuen Button "Freigabe beantragen".
In der Standard-Konfiguration bleiben Bestellungen mit diesem Status auch für den Shopbetreiber unsichtbar (diese Einstellung ist konfigurierbar).
Bestellungen mit dem Status "Freigabe beantragt" haben keinen Einfluss auf den Lagerbestand, erst im Augenblick der Freigabe dieser Anfrage wird der verfügbare Lagerbestand gegengeprüft.
Bestellungen können angenommen oder abgelehnt werden, abgelehnte Bestellanfragen können auf Wunsch auch später wieder reaktiviert werden.
Die Erweiterung enthält für relevante Ereignisse eigene Business-Events, welche dann mit eigenen eMail-Layouts genutzt werden könnten (z.B. Benachrichtigung über Anfrage-Eingang).


Voraussetzung

  • App B2B Login (Basis)
infos.installationManual:
Voraussetzung für den Einsatz der Erweiterung:

  • App B2B Login (Basis) unter https://store.shopware.com/vio1246977431016/b2b-login-unser-b2b-basis-plugin.html


Installation

  • Die Installation erfolgt im App Manager
  • Dort dann die App aktivieren.
  • Konfigurieren (Rechte vergeben etc.)
    • Dies kann entweder in der Administration durch den Shopbetreiber oder durch den Kunden selbst in seiner Mitarbeiterverwaltung geschehen

infos.name: B2B Workflow
infos.description:
The VIO.App B2B Workflow adds a new group of employee rights: the order request.

With this, you can withdraw the right to place orders from employees; instead, the order request is assigned to them. It comes before "open" in the internal status of orders.
In the checkout, these employees see a new button "Request approval".
In the standard configuration, orders with this status also remain invisible to the shop operator (this setting is configurable).
Orders with the status "Release requested" have no influence on the stock level, the available stock is only cross-checked at the moment of release of this request.
Orders can be accepted or rejected, rejected order requests can also be reactivated later if desired.
The extension contains its own business events for relevant events, which could then be used with your own email layouts (e.g. notification of incoming enquiry).


Prerequisite
  • App B2B Login (Basic)

Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version)
infos.installationManual:
Prerequisite for the use of the extension:

  • App B2B Login (Basic) at https://store.shopware.com/en/vio1246977431016/b2b-login-our-b2b-basic-plugin.html

Installation

  • The installation is done in the App Manager
  • Activate the app there.
  • Configure (assign rights etc. if necessary)
    • This can be done either in the administration by the shop operator or by the customer himself in his employee administration
    .
infos.shortDescription: B2B Workflow adds a new group of employee rights: This allows you to remove the right to place orders from employees and assign the order request instead.
infos.highlights:
"Order request" as new status for orders
New button "Request approval" in the checkout
Order requests that were once rejected can be reactivated
Own business events (can be used e.g. for mail with notification of incoming order requests)
infos.features:
"Order request" as new status for orders
Configurable by shop operator: orders with this status also remain invisible for the shop operator
New button "Request approval" instead of "Order" in the checkout
Order requests that were once rejected can be reactivated
Available stock is cross-checked at the moment of release of an order request
Own business events (can be used e.g. for mail with notification of incoming order requests)

changelog.text: Added the privilege to view order releases of subordinate employees
configure availability of b2b workflow functionalities via rule in config

• Extension of the data in the order request events
  • Addition of additional events for the rejection or reopening of an order request
    • `checkout.employee.order.approval.rejected`
    • `checkout.employee.order.approval.reopened`

• Added link to header with the count of orders to approve add privileges to list only own order-requests, which are not approved or denied
  • Added privileges to list only own order-requests, which are not approved or denied
Provide order including all necessary associations in the CheckoutOrderPlacedEvent.
Display approving employee in the account at the order
Show "Apply for approval" button for employees only
add order extension `order.extensions.approvalEmployee` with employee data for `checkout.order.placed` event
